title: Perinatal Outcomes Following Nonadherence to Guideline-Based Screening for Gestational Diabetes: A Population-Based Cohort Study.
abstract: (Abstracted from Acta Obstet Gynecol Scand 2025;104:839-849) Gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM), defined as high blood sugar onset in pregnancy, is associated with adverse outcomes and increased long-term maternal diabetes risk. Screening protocols vary internationally, with some countries testing only high-risk pregnancies, but Canada has recommended universal screening since 2003.
